medical_history.chief_complaint: Menorrhagia, anemia, and fatigue due to recurrent uterine fibroids.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began around the age of 30 with persistent fatigue and heavy periods, progressively worsening over time. Initial myomectomy provided temporary relief, but symptoms returned approximately one year later with heavy bleeding and constant fatigue.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Therapeutic abortion in her 20s, cesarean delivery, chronic migraine headaches, depression, and obstructive sleep apnea.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of fibroids in sister and maternal aunt.
medical_history.social_history: Smokes half a pack of cigarettes per day for 23 years, drinks 1 to 2 alcoholic drinks weekly, attending school and lives with her young adult son.
